title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in the BRIC countries from 2014 to 2024
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 4 lines denoting Brazil, China, India, and Russia. The y axis indicates the GDP per capita in USD and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall China, and India are gradually increasing, Brazil, and Russia are gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Brazil, 2. China, 3. Russia, and lastly, 4. India.
Overall across the Year, Brazil mostly maintained the highest GDP per capita in USD when compared to others with a mean value of 9660.57, and it peaked at 2014.
After Brazil, China overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 4512.4, peaking at 2018.
The botommost line, India,  has a mean of 2274.07, and peaked at 2024.

Throughout the period, Brazil generally had the highest GDP per capita in USD relative to others with an average of 9660.57, and it reached its maximum at 2014 with a value of 12175.96.
Followed by China which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 4512.4 GDP per capita in USD,reaching its highest point  at 2018 with a value of 9580.0.

Overall China, and India are gradually increasing, Brazil, and Russia are gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Brazil, 2. China, 3. Russia, and lastly, 4. India.
Overall across the Year, Brazil mostly maintained the highest GDP per capita in USD when compared to others with a mean value of 9660.57, and it peaked at 2014.

India mostly had the least GDP per capita in USD with a mean value of 2274.07, which peaked at 2024 with a value of 3209.67.
The maximum GDP per capita in USD about 14811.79, occured at 2024 by China.
The minimum GDP per capita in USD about 1610.36, occured at 2014 by India.
